form.longName: PhenX PX750101 - Aided And Confirmed Awareness Of Televised Antitobacco
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes two questions from Sly et al. (2001) and Niederdeppe (2005). Questions assess whether or not a respondent has seen any televised anti-tobacco/anti-smoking advertisements; if so, the respondent is asked to describe the advertisement. In assessing aided awareness, respondents confirm whether they have seen the advertisement; in assessing confirmed awareness, respondents provide additional details about the advertisement.

module.longName: Aided and Confirmed Awareness of Televised Anti-tobacco Advertisements
module.preferredDefinition: Aided and Confirmed Awareness of Televised Anti-tobacco Advertisements

question.questionText: Have you recently seen an antismoking or antitobacco ad on TV that shows [provide either brief verbal, text or visual (screenshot or video)]? (tv_antismoking_ad)
What happens in this advertisement? (tv_antismoking_ad_content)

protocol.longName: Aided and Confirmed Awareness of Televised Anti-tobacco Advertisements
protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes two questions from Sly et al. (2001) and Niederdeppe (2005). Questions assess whether or not a respondent has seen any televised anti-tobacco/anti-smoking advertisements; if so, the respondent is asked to describe the advertisement. In assessing aided awareness, respondents confirm whether they have seen the advertisement; in assessing confirmed awareness, respondents provide additional details about the advertisement.

form.longName: PhenX PX750501 - Interpersonal Communication About Antitobacco Advertisi
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes two questions from the Evaluation of the Public Education Campaign on Teen Tobacco (ExPECTT-B) questionnaire. The first question assesses whether respondents talked about an anti-tobacco advertisement. If respondents have discussed the advertisement, they are asked follow-up items to determine their receptivity to the message. The second question asks specific questions related to the goals and objectives of the message. Thus, these secondary questions will vary by execution.

question.questionText: Did you talk to anyone about this ad? (antismoking_ad_discussion)
When you talked about this ad, did you talk about any of the following topics? Check all that apply (antismoking_ad_discussion_effect_coded)

validValue.meaningText: The person I was talking to or someone else I know should not smoke
validValue.description: The person I was talking to or someone else I know should not smoke

question.questionText: Specify: (antismoking_ad_discussion_effect_other)

protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes two questions from the Evaluation of the Public Education Campaign on Teen Tobacco (ExPECTT-B) questionnaire. The first question assesses whether respondents talked about an anti-tobacco advertisement. If respondents have discussed the advertisement, they are asked follow-up items to determine their receptivity to the message. The second question asks specific questions related to the goals and objectives of the message. Thus, these secondary questions will vary by execution.

form.longName: PhenX PX750601 - Local Tobacco Control Public Policies
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol uses tobacco control legislative data from the American Nonsmokers' Rights Foundation's (ANRF's) U.S. Tobacco Control Laws Database, a standardized system and national collection of local ordinances and board of health regulations containing provisions on clean indoor air, restrictions on youth access to tobacco, tobacco sales and distribution restrictions, tobacco advertising and promotion restrictions, tobacco excise taxes, and conditional use permits.

question.questionText: Does the municipality have 100% smokefree nonhospitality workplace laws? (local_tobacco_policies_nonhospitality)
Does the municipality have 100% smokefree restaurant laws? (local_tobacco_policies_restaurant)
Does the municipality have 100% smokefree freestanding bar laws? (local_tobacco_policies_bar)
Does the municipality have 100% smokefree hotel and motel guest room laws? (local_tobacco_policies_hotel)
Does the municipality have 100% smokefree hospital and psychiatric facility laws? (local_tobacco_policies_medicalfacilities)
Does the municipality have any laws restricting smoking at hospital and psychiatric facilities? (local_tobacco_policies_medicalfacilities_any)
If the municipality has any laws restricting smoking at hospital and psychiatric facilities, what are the details of the restrictions? (local_tobacco_policies_medicalfacilities_details)
Does the municipality have 100% smokefree airport laws? (local_tobacco_policies_airport)
What smoking policies does the municipality have at professsional American football stadiums? (local_tobacco_policies_football_stadiums)
What smoking policies does the municipality have at professional baseball stadiums? (local_tobacco_policies_baseball_stadiums)
What is the minimum number of units for the municipality to consider a building Market Rate Multiunit Housing? (local_tobacco_policies_marketratemultiunit_minimum)
Does the municipality restrict Market Rate Multiunit Housing to be 100% smokefree? (local_tobacco_policies_marketratemultiunit_restriction)
If all units in Market Rate Multiunit Housing are 100% smokefree, do the units have a patio or balcony? (local_tobacco_policies_marketratemultiunit_balcony)
If all units in Market Rate Multiunit Housing are 100% smokefree, are the units described as condominiums? (local_tobacco_policies_marketratemultiunit_condominium)

If the municipality does not restrict Market Rate Multiunit Housing to be 100% smokefree, are there laws that restrict percentage of units to be currently 100% smokefree? (local_tobacco_policies_marketratemultiunit_minimumpercentage)

If the municipality has laws that require Market Rate Multiunit housing to be smokefree, what is the minimum percentage of Market Rate Multiunit Housing that need to be smokefree? (local_tobacco_policies_marketratemultiunit_percentage)

If the municipality has laws that restrict a percentage of units in Market Rate Multiunit housing to be 100% smokefree, what is the initial effective date of said law? (local_tobacco_policies_marketratemultiunit_startdate)

If the municipality has laws that restrict a percentage of units in Market Rate Multiunit housing to be 100% smokefree, what is the final effective date of said law? (local_tobacco_policies_marketratemultiunit_enddate)
What is the minimum number of units for the municipality to consider a building Public/Affordable Multiunit Housing? (local_tobacco_policies_publicaffordablemultiunit_minimum)
Does the municipality restrict Public/Affordable Multiunit Housing to be 100% smokefree? (local_tobacco_policies_publicaffordablemultiunit_restriction)
If all units in Public/Affordable Multiunit Housing are 100% smokefree, do the units have a patio or balcony? (local_tobacco_policies_publicaffordablemultiunit_balcony)

If the municipality does not restrict Public/Affordable Multiunit Housing to be 100% smokefree, are there laws that restrict percentage of units to be currently 100% smokefree? (local_tobacco_policies_publicaffordablemultiunit_minimumpercentage)

If the municipality has laws that require Public/Affordable Multiunit housing to be smokefree, what is the minimum percentage of Public/Affordable Multiunit Housing that need to be smokefree? (local_tobacco_policies_publicaffordablemultiunit_percentage)

If the municipality has laws that restrict a percentage of units in Public/Affordable Multiunit housing to be 100% smokefree, what is the initial effective date of said law? (local_tobacco_policies_publicaffordablemultiunit_startdate)

If the municipality has laws that restrict a percentage of units in Public/Affordable Multiunit housing to be 100% smokefree, what is the final effective date of said law? (local_tobacco_policies_publicaffordablemultiunit_enddate)
Does the municipality have 100% smokefree private club laws? (local_tobacco_policies_private_clubs)
Does the municipality have 100% tobaccofree pharmacy laws? (local_tobacco_policies_pharmacy)
Does the municipality have 100% smokefree beach laws? (local_tobacco_policies_beach)
Does the municipality have 100% smokefree transit waiting area laws? (local_tobacco_policies_transit_stops)
Does the municipality have 100% smokefree outdoor dining and bar patio laws? (local_tobacco_policies_outdoor_dining)
Does the municipality have 100% smokefree park laws? (local_tobacco_policies_parks)
Does the municipality have 100% smokefree zoo laws? (local_tobacco_policies_zoos)
Does the municipality have tobacco advertising laws? (advertising via location/zoning, tombstone, public transit, retailer requirements) (local_tobacco_policies_advertising)
Does the municipality have conditional use permit laws? (local_tobacco_policies_conditional_use)
Does the municipality have youth access laws? (local_tobacco_policies_youth_access)

protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol uses tobacco control legislative data from the American Nonsmokers' Rights Foundation's (ANRF's) U.S. Tobacco Control Laws Database, a standardized system and national collection of local ordinances and board of health regulations containing provisions on clean indoor air, restrictions on youth access to tobacco, tobacco sales and distribution restrictions, tobacco advertising and promotion restrictions, tobacco excise taxes, and conditional use permits.

form.preferredDefinition: This protocol uses two questions from the American Legacy Foundation's Connecting Health and Technology Survey to assess the average amount of time spent using different types of media and viewing various social media sites.

headerInstruction.text: On an average day..... If none (no hours or minutes), please enter 0 (zero).

question.questionText: On an average day, how many hours do you spend On a TV set (such as watching live TV or TV, movies, or other video (such as Netflix) through Xbox, Roku, DVR, Smart TV playing video games) (media_use_hours_on_tv)

On an average day, how many minutes do you spend On a TV set (such as watching live TV or TV, movies, or other video (such as Netflix) through Xbox, Roku, DVR, Smart TV playing video games) (media_use_minutes_on_tv)
On an average day, how many hours do you spend On a Desktop or Laptop Computer (such as spending time online, playing games, watching video) (media_use_hours_on_computer)
On an average day, how many minutes do you spend On a Desktop or Laptop Computer (such as spending time online, playing games, watching video) (media_use_minutes_on_computer)
On an average day, how many hours do you spend On Your Smartphone or Tablet (such as spending time on apps, spending time online, playing games, watching video, etc.) (media_use_hours_on_mobile)
On an average day, how many minutes do you spend On Your Smartphone or Tablet (such as spending time on apps, spending time online, playing games, watching video, etc.) (media_use_minutes_on_mobile)
On an average day, how much time do you spend on any social media site (ex: Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Pinterest, Snapchat)? (media_use_time_social_media)

protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol uses two questions from the American Legacy Foundation's Connecting Health and Technology Survey to assess the average amount of time spent using different types of media and viewing various social media sites.

form.longName: PhenX PX750901 - Perceived Effectiveness Of Antitobacco Advertising
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes six questions of perceived effectiveness from the Perceived Effectiveness of Cessation Advertisements study to assess whether perceived effectiveness for anti-tobacco ads are causally related to tobacco-related behaviors and outcomes. Participants of the study are asked to provide their appraisals of ad effectiveness after viewing an ad.

question.questionText: These ads are worth remembering (perceived_effectiveness_antitobacco_advertising_memory)
These ads grabbed my attention (perceived_effectiveness_antitobacco_advertising_attention)
These ads are powerful (perceived_effectiveness_antitobacco_advertising_powerful)
These ads are informative (perceived_effectiveness_antitobacco_advertising_informative)
These ads are meaningful (perceived_effectiveness_antitobacco_advertising_meaningful)
These ads are convincing (perceived_effectiveness_antitobacco_advertising_convincing)

protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes six questions of perceived effectiveness from the Perceived Effectiveness of Cessation Advertisements study to assess whether perceived effectiveness for anti-tobacco ads are causally related to tobacco-related behaviors and outcomes. Participants of the study are asked to provide their appraisals of ad effectiveness after viewing an ad.

form.longName: PhenX PX751001 - Selfreported Exposure To Smoking On Television And In T
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol uses one item from the Survey of Teen Opinions about Retail Environments (STORE), a school-based survey that included 1,681 adolescents (ages 11-14 years). This item assesses perceived exposure to people who smoke in movies or on television.

module.longName: Self-reported Exposure to Smoking on Television and in the Movies
module.preferredDefinition: Self-reported Exposure to Smoking on Television and in the Movies

question.questionText: In the past 7 days, how often did you see TV shows or movies where someone was smoking? (selfreported_exposure_smoking_tv_movies)

protocol.longName: Self-reported Exposure to Smoking on Television and in the Movies
protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol uses one item from the Survey of Teen Opinions about Retail Environments (STORE), a school-based survey that included 1,681 adolescents (ages 11-14 years). This item assesses perceived exposure to people who smoke in movies or on television.

form.longName: PhenX PX750801 - Neighborhoodlevel Racial Ethnic Composition

protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol uses data from the U.S. Census Bureau on the racial/ethnic composition of a neighborhood, which can be calculated at the census-tract or block-group level. The relevant variables are available from the long form of the 2010 decennial Census.

form.longName: PhenX PX751201 - State Tobacco Control Public Policies
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol is based on extracting state legislative and Medicaid data from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's State Tobacco Activities Tracking and Evaluation (STATE) System, an interactive data system that houses and displays current and historical state-level data on tobacco use prevention and control laws and policies. The STATE System is designed to integrate many data sources to provide comprehensive summary data and facilitate research and consistent data interpretation.

protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol is based on extracting state legislative and Medicaid data from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's State Tobacco Activities Tracking and Evaluation (STATE) System, an interactive data system that houses and displays current and historical state-level data on tobacco use prevention and control laws and policies. The STATE System is designed to integrate many data sources to provide comprehensive summary data and facilitate research and consistent data interpretation.

form.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes eight questions from the National Adult Tobacco Survey (NATS) that are used to assess a respondent's exposure to and compliance with worksite policies on tobacco.

question.questionText: Are you currently working for pay or are you selfemployed, either parttime or fulltime? (worksite_policies_employment_status)
Do you currently have one job or more than one job? (worksite_policies_employment_number)

Please answer the following questions for the job at which you spend the most time. INTERVIEWER: IF THE RESPONDENT SPENDS THE MOST TIME AT TWO OR MORE JOBS EQUALLY, ASK THEM TO CHOOSE THE ONE AT WHICH THEY HAVE BEEN WORKING THE LONGEST. IF THEY STILL CAN'T CHOOSE ONE JOB, ASK THEM TO CHOOSE THE ONE THEY LIKE THE MOST. INTERVIEWER: IF RESPONDENT WORKS IN MORE THAN ONE, PLEASE READ: "Please choose the setting in which you spend the most time." INTERVIEWER: IF THE RESPONDENT SPENDS THE MOST TIME AT TWO OR MORE SETTINGS EQUALLY, PLEASE READ: "Of the [SAY: Number of settings], please choose the setting at which you have been working the longest."INTERVIEWER: IF THE RESPONDENT STILL CAN'T CHOOSE, PLEASE READ: "Of the [SAY: Number of settings], please choose the setting which you like the most." (info_751401)
Most of the time, do you work.....? (worksite_policies_employment_location)

validValue.meaningText: 04 Indoors in a place like an office building, retail store, restaurant, or factory
validValue.description: 04 Indoors in a place like an office building, retail store, restaurant, or factory

question.questionText: Specify: (specify_751401)
The next few questions refer to smoking in indoor areas. When answering the questions, please count your vehicle as an indoor area. (indoor_751401)

Now I'm going to ask you about smoke you might have breathed at work because someone else was smoking, either indoors or outdoors. During the past 7 days, that is, since last [TODAY'S DAY OF WEEK], on how many days did you breathe the smoke at your workplace from someone other than you who was smoking tobacco? (worksite_policies_employment_secondhandsmoking_days)

Now I'm going to ask you about smoke you might have breathed at work because someone else was smoking, either indoors or outdoors. During the past 7 days, that is, since last [TODAY'S DAY OF WEEK], on how many days did you breathe the smoke at your workplace from someone other than you who was smoking tobacco? (worksite_policies_employment_secondhandsmoking_coded)
At your workplace, is smoking in indoor areas.....? (worksite_policies_employment_smoking_indoors)

validValue.meaningText: Allowed only at some times or in some places
validValue.description: Allowed only at some times or in some places

question.questionText: At your workplace, is smoking in outdoor areas....? (worksite_policies_employment_smoking_outdoors)

validValue.meaningText: Allowed only at some times or in some places
validValue.description: Allowed only at some times or in some places

question.questionText: At your workplace, is the use of chewing tobacco, snuff, dip, or snus....? (worksite_policies_employment_smokeless_products)

validValue.meaningText: Allowed only at some times or in some places
validValue.description: Allowed only at some times or in some places

question.questionText: To your knowledge, during the past 30 days, that is, since [DATE FILL], has anyone, including yourself, used tobacco of any kind at your work when he or she was not supposed to? (worksite_policies_employment_violation)

protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes eight questions from the National Adult Tobacco Survey (NATS) that are used to assess a respondent's exposure to and compliance with worksite policies on tobacco.

form.longName: PhenX PX751501 - Youth Cigarette Purchase Behaviors And Experiences
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes five questions from the University of Michigan and National Institutes of Health's 2010 Monitoring the Future (MTF) project survey that capture data related to youth purchase behaviors and experiences.

headerInstruction.text: During the last 30 days, about how many times (if any) have you bought cigarettes.....

module.longName: Youth Cigarette Purchase Behaviors and Experiences
module.preferredDefinition: Youth Cigarette Purchase Behaviors and Experiences

question.questionText: .....by having a friend or relative buy them for you? (youth_purchase_history_via_relative_friend)
....on your own from vending machines? (youth_purchase_history_via_vending_machine)
....through the mail? (youth_purchase_history_via_mail)
......in a store where you pick up the pack (or carton) and bring it to the checkout counter? (youth_purchase_history_via_store_unassisted)
.....in a store where the clerk has to hand you the pack or carton? (youth_purchase_history_via_store_assisted)
....bought them in some other way? (youth_purchase_history_via_other_way)
.....at a big supermarket? (youth_purchase_history_big_supermarket)
.....at a small grocery store? (youth_purchase_history_small_grocery)
.....at a drugstore? (youth_purchase_history_drugstore)
.....at a convenience store (like a HopIn or 711) or a gas station? (youth_purchase_history_convenience_store)
.....from a website? (youth_purchase_history_website)
What brand of cigarettes do you usually smoke? (Brands are in alphabetical order. Mark only one.) (youth_purchase_history_brand_loyalty)
Other specify: (specify_751501)
The last time that you tried to buy cigarettes in a store or gas station, were you asked for proof of age? (youth_purchase_id_check)

validValue.meaningText: I never tried to buy cigarettes at a store or gas station
validValue.description: I never tried to buy cigarettes at a store or gas station

validValue.meaningText: No, they didn't ask me and they sold me cigarettes

protocol.longName: Youth Cigarette Purchase Behaviors and Experiences
protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes five questions from the University of Michigan and National Institutes of Health's 2010 Monitoring the Future (MTF) project survey that capture data related to youth purchase behaviors and experiences.
